oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Spanish-American War parade
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Jim Thompson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: 4th Tennessee Regiment leaving for the Spanish-American War. (The Fourth Tennessee Regiment was mustered into federal service at Camp Poland, Knoxville, on July 13, 1898). Parade on Gay Street. Shows men in uniform on horseback and marching in formation on Gay Street, Knoxville, TN.. American flags at right. At left: Electric Dental Co., John A. McMillan & Co. Drugs, S/B. Newman Printers & Book Binders, McCormick.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Military parades & ceremonies; Military personnel; Military officers; Military uniforms; Horses; Flags;
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: To use photographs or to order reproductions, contact DigitalCollections@knoxlib.org or phone 865 215-8808. Please refer to Image Number if available and provide a brief description of the photograph.
